com.github.thorbenkuck.netcom2.network.client

Interface RemoteObjectAccess

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ClientStart

    public interface RemoteObjectAccess
    This interface provides a way of getting RemoteObjects.

    The ClientStart for example implements this method. So you may get any RemoteObject by stating 

    
 class Example {
     private ClientStart clientStart;
     ...

     public void run() {
         TestObject testObject = clientStart.getRemoteObject(TestObject.class);
     }
 }

    It returns an actual, callable instance of the provided Class. However, the Method-call will be delegated to the Server. The Server then calculates results based upon the real Object, registered at the RemoteObjectRegistration and then return this Result back to the Client.

    Further any Throwable encountered while running the real Object will be pinged back to the executing client.

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    See Also:
    IgnoreRemoteExceptions, SingletonRemoteObject, RemoteObjectHandler

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <T> T getRemoteObject(Class<T> clazz)
      The call of this Method will result in a callable instance of the provided class.
      void updateRemoteInvocationProducer(InvocationHandlerProducer invocationHandlerProducer)
      This Method changes the InvocationHandlerProducer set internally.

    • Method Detail

      • getRemoteObject

        @Experimental
<T> T getRemoteObject(Class<T> clazz)
        The call of this Method will result in a callable instance of the provided class.

        This instance will be delegating the query back to the Server and return any result and throw any Throwable back from the Server.

        This Method will potentially be deprecated in the future.

        Use ClientStart.getRemoteObjectFactory() instead

        Type Parameters:
        T - the Type, identified by the provided class
        Parameters:
        clazz - the Class of the Object that should be created
        Returns:
        an callable instance of the type T
        See Also:
        RemoteObjectFactory

      • updateRemoteInvocationProducer

        @Experimental
void updateRemoteInvocationProducer(InvocationHandlerProducer invocationHandlerProducer)
        This Method changes the InvocationHandlerProducer set internally.

        The InvocationHandlerProducer creates a new Instance if getRemoteObject(Class) is called. By changing this InvocationHandlerProducer, you can provide a custom RemoteObjectHandler to be used internally

        Parameters:
        invocationHandlerProducer - the InvocationHandlerProducer that should create the RemoteObjectHandler
        See Also:
        InvocationHandlerProducer
